title: The British isles through an opera glass,
author: Taylor, Charles M.
snippet: Passing through the village, which is inhabited  by the workmen of the neighboring slate quarries, and is a pretty little place, we drive along the bank of Loch Leven, surrounded by lofty mountain scenery, which has been the inspiration  of many poets and authors, and enter the Pass of Glencoe at the bridge where the road skirts the River Coe, between the great Sgor-na- Ciche, 2430 feet high, and Meall Mor, 2215 feet.
